@@ -55,2 +55,2 @@ - java.security package. Some are checked only once at startup of the VM, - and therefore are best set using the -D option of the java command, + java.security package. Some are checked only once at startup of the VM, + and therefore are best set using the -D option of the java command, @@ -65,4 +65,1 @@ - To view security properties, security providers, and TLS-related settings, - specify the -XshowSettings:security option in the java command. - You can enable debugging in JGSS and other related technologies with various system properties or environment variables. - The following table lists java.security.debug options table:

+ The following table lists java.security.debug options table:

@@ -171,8 +168,0 @@ - - +thread - Print thread and caller information - - - +timestamp - Print timestamp information - @@ -193,0 +182,13 @@ +

Printing Thread and Timestamp Information

+

+ You can append the following strings to the value specified in the java.security.debug + system property to print additional information: +

    +
  • +thread:Print thread and caller information
    • +
  • +timestamp:Print timestamp information
    • +
+

+ For example, to add thread, caller, and timestamp information to all debuging output, + set the java.security.debug system property on the command line as follows: + java -Djava.security.debug=all+thread+timestamp MyApp +
